body_html:
Hi @lancerts,
You can use given input_fn utilities and also do preprocess. Following is shows an example:

def my_input_fn():
  features, labels = tf.estimator.inputs.pandas_input_fn(...)
  features['a'] = preprocess(features['a'])

Also please try using tf.data.* utilities. Following SO question has an example answer: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/47732186/tensorflow-tf-record-too-large-to-be-loaded-into-an-np-array-at-once

body:
Hi @lancerts,
You can use given input_fn utilities and also do preprocess. Following is shows an example:
```
def my_input_fn():
  features, labels = tf.estimator.inputs.pandas_input_fn(...)
  features['a'] = preprocess(features['a'])
```
Also please try using `tf.data.*` utilities. Following SO question has an example answer: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/47732186/tensorflow-tf-record-too-large-to-be-loaded-into-an-np-array-at-once
